medicines.name: Paracetamol (Acetaminophen) 500 mg
medicines.frequency: Every 6–8 hours as needed; max 3 g/day
medicines.notes: Avoid combining with other acetaminophen products.

medicines.name: Ibuprofen 200 mg
medicines.notes: Avoid if ulcer/kidney issues unless advised.

precautions: Seek care if fever > 3 days, > 39.4°C, or with severe symptoms.
food: Plenty of fluids and light meals.
Avoid alcohol when taking acetaminophen or ibuprofen.

medicines.name: Saline nasal spray
medicines.notes: Helps congestion; safe with most meds.

precautions: See a clinician if symptoms persist > 7–10 days or high fever develops.
Decongestants can raise blood pressure; avoid unless approved.
food: Warm fluids, soups, and honey (not for infants <1 year).

precautions: Seek urgent care for sudden severe headache, head injury, or neurological symptoms.
Limit painkillers to avoid rebound headaches.
food: Hydration; regular meals; reduce caffeine excess.

medicines.name: Omeprazole 20 mg
medicines.frequency: Once daily for up to 14 days

precautions: See a clinician for persistent symptoms, weight loss, or difficulty swallowing.
food: Avoid late-night meals; elevate head end during sleep.
Reduce spicy, fatty foods, caffeine, and alcohol.

precautions: Seek immediate care for breathing difficulty or facial swelling.
Check interactions if on other medications.
food: Rinse after outdoor exposure; keep windows closed during high pollen.
